channel.title: I have a question regarding the > > > bar at the top
channel.description:
I'm probably not the only one that notices this, but I'd like to point it out.
If you look at the top of this thread you'll see this:
[code]Moparisthebest.com > Other > General site discussions > I have a question regarding the > > > bar at the top.[/code]
You can use the links to go back to the index, etc.
That's standard with SMF, right? However, if you look at a fresh installation of SMF, the same bar is also at the bottom of every thread, but at MITB it's not.
Is the reason that it's missing because we upgraded from a somewhat older version of SMF and it wasn't included, or did someone do some CSS experimenting and delete it by accident?
I'm just wondering because I hate having to scroll to the top to go back to the board. (Pushing the back button in the browser does not fulfill my purpose, as I want it to refresh at the same time as it goes back, so the 'new' icons display, yes I'm lazy.)
Just wondering.

item.title: I have a question regarding the > > > bar at the top
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

No doubt, it was lost during one of the mods installed because Mopar had to go through hell (I believe) pissing about editing all the files for compatibility.

Read full topic
item.source: I have a question regarding the > > > bar at the top

item.title: I have a question regarding the > > > bar at the top
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

If scrolling up is bad then simply hit the home key.

Read full topic

item.description:

Ehh, I don’t recall but I’m pretty sure it was 1.0.*

item.title: I have a question regarding the > > > bar at the top
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“therealjdb, post:5, topic:143389”][quote author=VB7 Rocks link=topic=196689.msg1757382#msg1757382 date=1189844508]
Okay. Kind of strange though. When did they start including it in new installs?
[/quote]

No idea, maybe they have it listed as a new feature on their site, go check :P[/quote]

I don’t think they’d include something that small a change in their update glossary, seeing as how:

docs.simplemachines.org:

Most of SMF’s features (including all the most important ones) are covered here.

Probably not an important update, but it’s kind of convenient.

(Actually, do you know what version of SMF MITB started with? Was it a 1.0.* series and then ported over to 1.1.? Because I think all the 1.1.'s had the bar at the bottom)

Read full topic
item.source: I have a question regarding the > > > bar at the top

item.title: I have a question regarding the > > > bar at the top
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

1337h4x:

Just use the scroll wheel…scrolling it is 5x easier then clicking a link.

A link at the bottom of the thread is faster if it’s a thread like “Repost: Post your Picture!” and everyone uses ‘direct link to image’ instead of thumbnails, it takes like 6 seconds to get to the top gahhh nooo 6 seconds ahh

therealjdb:

Just use the => General site discussions + go and navigate back.

Wha… Who put that there when I wasn’t looking! Thanks lol, I never saw it… (Stupid me)

therealjdb:

And I believe that it was never included in the updates just the new installs.

Okay. Kind of strange though. When did they start including it in new installs?

Read full topic
